channel.title: Laptops?
channel.description: Well im getting a new laptop soon, and i need to know what place is a good place to buy one. My Dad rules and is paying for halve of the price and i will have $650 or more on april 7th. So i will be able to get a 1,300 dollar laptop. What places come with a good deal? Please post here

item.title: Laptops?
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

with that low settings maybe.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:43, topic:71971”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=105727.msg1083376#msg1083376 date=1175580375]

Are you 100% sure you want a laptop? I would personally recommend just building a custom desktop. Would be a LOT cheaper, and it’s not too terribly hard as long as you have a tutorial.

I want to build a cheap desktop, hopefully I can get a goodish pc to auto on rs for less than £70. I’m going to have to look around though, cheapest I’ve seen is £120 and 512mb ram, not sure processor specs.
[/quote]

don’t think you need a top of the line processor to use runescape.[/quote]

I know but all <£70 ones I’ve seen are shit processor specs and I doubt could run it, with all the new shit they’ve added and lack of specs update.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:16, topic:71971”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=105727.msg1061879#msg1061879 date=1175149229]
Get an Alien Ware, Alien Ware ftw! And only get Vista if your comfortable with having it. It’s not compatible with a lot of programs.
[/quote]

Thanks, this is what i think im get

Intel® Core™ 2 Duo Processor T5500 1.66GHz 2MB Cache 667MHz FSB
Genuine Windows® Vista Home Premium
15.4" WideXGA 1280 x 800 LCD - Saucer Silver
Alienware® Intel® 945PM + ICH7 Chipset
1GB Dual Channel DDR2 SO-DIMM at 667MHz - 2 x 512MB
120GB Serial ATA 1.5Gb/s 5,400 RPM w/ 8MB Cache
128MB ATI Mobility™ Radeon® X1400
Intel® 7.1 High-Definition Audio
Internal Intel® PRO Wireless 3945 a/b/g Mini-Card
Additional Battery - Alienware® Area-51 m5550 6-cell Lithium-Ion Battery

Total cost: $1,199.00 as low as $36/mo.* !!!
Thats like perfect… I might! get ;)[/quote]

Only get Alienware if your a gamer.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:35, topic:71971”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=105727.msg1061461#msg1061461 date=1175141313]

If your desperate, buy a 512mb ram inspiron 1501 from dell, and buy 2gb laptop ram for it and replace it. Roughly $1.4k for $1k.

i got a better deal at office depot rofl…
1.6 gig ram
2 gig memory
120gig hard drive
windows vista home preminum. (installed already)
and thats only for $900…

1.6gb ram, 2gb memory? Memory IS ram.

Mine - 1.8ghz amd turion 64(dual core), 2b ram, 80gb hdd. Vista sucks compared to some linux distros so I didn’t touch it. Roughly $1k.
[/quote]

2 BITS WTF!?111!!!1!1!!!?
I think you mean 2gb?[/quote]

Yah lol. I mean 2GB. I still got a 32mb stick of ram somewhere.

MybJames:

un-named, whats your graphics card like?

It’s pretty crappy(integrated) but it can run AOE3 with 200 models on lowest detain pretty damn good, and that’s a demanding game. I suggest replacing it if you can though.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“DeadBird, post:6, topic:71971”][quote author=gothic queen link=topic=105727.msg1061372#msg1061372 date=1175139928]
heh my laptops alright
acer inspire 5100
acer had a bad name in the past, but is coming back positive:)
i suppose circuit city had a good warenty for mine…whole package for under 1200$
[/quote]
Acer is good if you expect your laptop to break\die within a year.[/quote]

My Acer travelmate has lasted a good few years and is still a top notch laptop. I’ve also got an Acer PDA that is going strong. I think Acer is a fairly decent company, their support also seems pretty good, my friend had an acer laptop that died and it was easy to get replaced.

Read full topic
